result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus B. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

Defendant to maintain timely, uninterrupted payments as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 2005PA40PJ.  Orders subject to modification in the future by further order of the Court. All payments are to be paid through the Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund (WISCTF), not through the Department of Corrections. **COURT ORDERS IF THE DEFENDANT DOES NOT MAKE TIMELY PAYMENTS AND THE AGENT OF RECORD DOES NOT REQUEST A PROBATION REVIEW HEARING, THE COURT WILL FIND THE AGENT IN CONTEMPT OF COURT**
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit. Court does not object to jail transfer

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: ***Based on the letter submitted by the Department of Corrections on November 23, 2020 the Court amends the Credit for Time Served to reflect 168 days.***

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment.
Defendant to maintain timely, uninterrupted payments as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 05PA40.

Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid.   The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims.

Sentencing on Revocation - August 24, 2016

Case called @ 2:21 p.m. Defendant Marcus B. King in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Defendant Marcus B. King in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zouski appears regarding unfulfilled financial obligations. The parties have received and reviewed the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be noted. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. The parties stipulate to 167 days CFTS. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Selsing. No statement by the DE. Court orders: 3 year 6 month bifurcated SEH as to each count concurrent - 18 mos IC/2 yrs ES - 167 days CFTS. ES Conditions:  Maintain CSUP obligations as to underlying Case No. 05PA40, Maintain full time gainful employment,Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid -   The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims. DE eligible for ERP/Eligible for CIP. Appeal rights given.

FTP matters: The Court withdraws the warrant previously issued.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

records.addlTxt: 1:45 pm cases called. 10CF174 & 14CF128. Defendant Marcus B. King in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of conflict with DA addressed. Agreement reached and read into record. 10CF174-DA would withdraw motion for revoke PPDA. Preliminary hearing waived. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Zilles confirms receipt and waives further reading.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 14CF174-No Contest to Count 1 & 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads in Count 3 & 4. Court allows motion to revoke PPDA and allows matter to proceed to conclusion. Sentencing argument by Attorney Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Zilles. Statement by defendant. Court makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 4 years. CONDITIONS: CT 1- 90 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No credit for Time served. To Commence no later than December 1, 2014. Court does not object to jail transfer. CONDITIONS ON EACH COUNT: Maintain timely Child Support payments in Waushara County case 05PA40PJ. If any non-compliance with the terms of the payment schedule, the Probation Agent is to request a Probation Review. If Agent does not adhere, court will find Agent in contempt of court. Maintain a valid address with court and child support. Maintain employment. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 30, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

10CF174 & 14CF128 cases called. Attorney Paul Zilles in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Offer exchanged requests plea & sentencing hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  14CF-128:    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of the 20 day time limit for pre-lim hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 02:50 pm.

Motion hearing on September 26, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Maintain payments as ordered as to companion Waushara Co Case No. 2005PA000040.

Case Called @ 1:09 PM: Defendant Marcus B. King in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD admits receipt of new charging in 14CF-128.  10CF-174:  Complaint/Charges Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Counsel note Defendant failed to appear for a prior motion hearing and warrant was issued.  Per ADA:  Requests motion hearing track along with new matter.  14CF-128:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived by Stipulation of counsel.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed - counsel will be appointed.  ADA argues as to bond - Agent confirmed from Agent that Defendant had been in absconder status with possible new charges.  Requests $4000-$5000 cash bond in light of 2nd charging and growing arrearage.  SPD argues for significantly lower cash bond.  Def currently unemployed and was previously homeless.  Def now has stable residence in Racine with fiance.  The Court:  Will reluctantly accept the request by SPD for a lesser cash bond and orders the cash bond of $500 cash bond with conditions as requested by the State.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
